item.title: Radar Scattering Prediction
item.description: I organized SnowEx 2022 hackweek in collaboration with NASA. During the hackweek, I also worked on a project of “Radar Scattering Prediction” About the project This project aims to estimate the backscattering of radar from snowpits using parameters from SnowEx data such as density, temperature, grain size and height. We are also trying to understand the relationship between these input parameters and the backscatter and evaluate the parameter sensitivity. And want to explore the link between SnowEx pit measurements and input parameters of DMRT-Bic.

We are also trying to understand the relationship between these input parameters and the backscatter and evaluate the parameter sensitivity. And want to explore the link between SnowEx pit measurements and input parameters of DMRT-Bic.

item.title: Mind Reading using Artificial Intelligence
item.description: About the project Human communication works by turning thought into motion. However, sometimes it would be really handy if we could communicate directly from our brain. Studies on brain imaging show that different spatial patterns of neural activation are associated with thinking about different semantic categories of words and so we have attempted to “Mind Read” by applying machine learning algorithms on data from functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) reports to predict the category of words that a person may be thinking of.

item.title: Restaurant Visitor Forecasting
item.description: About the project La Pino’z Pizza is India’s fastest growing and the most popular Pizza chain. The first pizzeria opened up in Chandigarh in 2011 and now there are more than 350 outlets across India. A few of these outlets belong to my father. Even though this is a very up and coming, new generation Pizza place in India, I have seen first hand how the business works - the same old traditional way.

item.title: The Pac-Man Projects
item.description: About the projects The Pac-Man projects were developed for UC Berkeley’s introductory artificial intelligence course, CS 188. They apply an array of AI techniques to playing Pac-Man. They teach foundational AI concepts, such as informed state-space search, probabilistic inference, and reinforcement learning. These concepts underly real-world application areas such as natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics. Why did I work on these projects? The projects allowed me to visualize the results of the techniques they implement.

item.title: Statistical Analysis of News Articles
item.description: About the project Social media is a real world phenomenon of the saying “If the tree falls on the ground and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound?” Mashable, an independent news platform, is a part of this social media world providing the latest news articles on digital culture, social media and technology. However, not every new article is a hit, and our group aims to find what makes an article popular by analyzing various factors related to the article.
